plugins.name: Befront
plugins.description:
Done watching video tutorials and reading about UX/UI? It's time to get your hands dirty and finally start doing it!

Complete all the trainings and interactive courses inside our UX/UI simulator to refine your skills and start designing like a pro


üí° Build muscle memory in the app: train yourself in a crucial design tool - Figma - with our hands-on Figma Basics course right within Figma. No more juggling between apps.

üìö Practice with real-world design exercises: challenge yourself on bite-sized UX/UI tasks and arcades. Develop an eye for design with eye-training exercises - right within Figma. No more switching back and forth.

üßê Get Instant Feedback: Every practical task is auto-checked for correctness, ensuring you're on the right track. No more guesswork - we instantly provide feedback and highlight errors, ensuring you're on the right track.

üéØ Complete trainings, create interfaces from scratch, and take away portfolio-worthy deliverables.


How it works:

  1. Click "Try it out" button at the top right corner of the page;
  2. On a blank Figma file, search for "Befront" under Plugins and open it up;
  3. Sign up and set up account;
  4. Start learning.


Learning design has never been this easy and convenient! Imagine the power to design within Figma and get real-time feedback. It's unreal, isn't it?

  1. Bite-sized tasks and gamified mechanisms to make your learning easy and fun;
  2. 7 types of interactive lessons to test your knowledge;
  3. Step-by-step instructions by industry best to make your learning experience smooth and easy

Get started with Befront today and elevate your design skills to new heights!üé®

____________________

Learn more about Befront https://befront.io

Instagram Befront.io

Feedback and contributions are welcome via: info@befront.io

plugins.name: Adjustments
plugins.description:
These HSL color adjustments allow you to tweak hue, saturation and lightness values of multiple selected objects at once.

The simple idea behind three sliders becomes a powerful tool when it comes to experiencing color.

You can tweak your palette, find new sweet and vibrant color combinations, make a color theory research or accidentally create brand new design trend.

Adjustments affect all fills, strokes and effects color parameters in the selection including gradient stops. Current version doesn't yet process raster images and mixed text color properties (but you still can have them in your selection).

Adjustments work with any selection including groups and frames, but keep in mind that large selections can impact performance badly.

Any selection change with plugin already running results in resetting the sliders and rebuilding selection color data (careful on large selections).

plugins.name: Slide Show
plugins.description:
Slide Show is a simple yet powerful utility that lets you turn any page of unlinked frames into a slide show presentation that you control while others watch in real time.


It's easy:


  1. Rename your frames in alphabetical order (numbers appear before letters).
  2. Turn off visibility for frames you don't want to show.
  3. Share your prototype link or embed to viewers.
  4. Start the Slide Show plugin and be amazed!


Navigate from frame to frame, or restart your slide show. (To start from a specific frame, select it before running the plugin.)


Keynote Live and PowerPoint Present Live are neat, but Figma's now a viable alternative, thanks to this plugin.


  • Ditch screen shares and present crisp graphics!
  • Embed your slide show anywhere!
  • Multiple frame sizes? Easy peasy!
  • Forget complex transitions. Less is more!
  • Live editing of slides? Yes!


For best results, use a Figma prototype link (or embed) with these parameters: scaling=contain and hide-ui=1. This ensures viewers see content at the largest size possible with minimum distraction.


Important: When using Slide Show, you must remove all Flow starting points on your page. However, you CAN keep existing prototype interactions in place! This is brand new to Figma and amazing!


Tip: For presenter notes or other content that's not viewable by readers, simply place them on the background canvas. Just make sure it's not in a frame.


While anyone can use this plugin, it was built especially for LexGo to easily control guided presentations designed in Figma.


NEW FEATURES!

Jump to Slide: Navigate to any slide quickly!


Random Slide: Great for quizzes and flash cards!


Hide Slide: Great for running through a presentation and hiding unwanted slides quickly.

accepted.name: Nelson Taruc
accepted.description: My design philosophy: Focus. Boost signal, kill noise. Solve the first problem. Embrace uncertainty.

plugins.name: Easy Font Swap
plugins.description:
Introducing the Easy Font Swap, designed to help you streamline your design workflow by allowing you to swap entire font families in a single click. Say goodbye to the manual task of adjusting individual text sizes, weights or styles - our plugin handles it all for you!


Its like Magic

With Font Swap, simply select a frame containing text elements or directly on individual text elements and choose a new font family from the plugin. It will automatically apply the new font to your text, preserving existing styles, weights, and sizes. Missing font weights? No problem! Easy Font Swap closely replaces them according to Mozilla's font weight fallback guidelines, ensuring consistency across your design.


To use the Font Swap plugin, follow these easy steps:

  1. Install the plugin from the Figma Community.
  2. Open the Font Swap plugin
  3. Select a frame containing text elements or directly selecting your text elements that you wish to modify.
  4. Tick the checkboxes of the corresponding font family that you would like to swap out.
  5. Search and select the desired replacement font family with our integrated font name search.
  6. Click on the "Apply New Font" button to apply it to your text.


Support me

If you find the Easy Font Swap plugin valuable and want to support its development, please consider becoming a supporter on Ko-fi! Your support helps me continue to create and maintain useful tools for you and the figma design community. Visit my Ko-fi page at https://ko-fi.com/joshiee to learn more and show your support.


Contact me at hello@joshiee.design if you need support or just wanna share how this tool helped you and your workflow!
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly Swap Fonts: One-click font family changes, preserve your styles, weights, and sizes!

plugins.name: SF Symbol Creator
plugins.description:
Create, preview, and export SF Symbols 3 icons for use in macOS and iOS applications


Rendering modes


macOS and iOS can display your icons in different modes:


- Monochrome Mode: Layers are displayed using a single color

- Hierarchical Mode: Layers are displayed using a single color, but with different transparencies.

- Palette Mode:  Layers are displayed using different colors

- Multicolor Mode: Layers are displayed using different colors as defined by the creator


Colors need to be picked from the defined palette of system colors, which can be automatically added to your document by the plugin.


Layers and naming


Use a Component with Variants. Individual icons should be named Name=your-icon-name, Size=16. Layer names don‚Äôt matter, but the layer order does for display in Hierarchy Mode. You can have a maximum of three layers per icon, but a layer can consist of multiple shapes merged together.


Creating shapes


Layers need to be flattened and ungrouped.


Figma‚Äôs path logic doesn‚Äôt always match what SF Symbols expects. This can result in inner gaps being filled in when they shouldn‚Äôt. This is a known issue and has been reported. Here are some tips to prevent this:


- Use the Pen tool as much as possible. Even to create basic shapes like rectangles and ovals

- Use Exclude Selection instead of Subtract Selection for boolean groups

- Use the Flatten Selection (Cmd+E) command to flatten boolean groups

- Use the Outline Stroke (Cmd+Shft+O) command to turn strokes into paths


The plugin will warn you about any issues when exporting. If the icon still doesn‚Äôt render correctly, try to link inner gaps with the outside of the icon by an invisible 0 width channel. Or cut a shape up into separate paths so that there are no inside gaps and then Union them together.


Exporting


After exporting you can extract the .zip file and drag and drop the .svg files into the SF Symbols 3 app.


Note: currently only a single weight is supported.

accepted.name: Microsoft
accepted.description: The official account for Microsoft Design.

plugins.tagline: Create, preview, and export SF Symbols 3 icons for use in macOS and iOS applications.

plugins.name: Movie Posters
plugins.description:
Add a random popular movie or TV series poster.

1. Select any vector object and run the plugin (repeat with as many objects as necessary). The plugin will fetch a poster image and add it as a filler on your selected object.

2. Run the plugin without anything selected and it will add an element with a poster image.

3. The posters are aggregated from the mustapp.com database and are automatically updated according to their popularity.

plugins.name: Maze
plugins.description:
The Maze plugin allows you to easily import large and complex Figma files into Maze to run usability tests. The plugin is optimized for importing large files in Maze and can handle files that were previously not importable through the traditional import due to their size.


To import a file on Maze through the Maze plugin:


1. Install the Maze plugin in Figma.

2. Go to Maze to start.

3. Create a new maze and add a Prototype test block.

4. Click on Add prototype.

5. Click on ‚ÄúTry it out‚Äù under the ‚ÄúMaze plugin for Figma‚Äùbox. If you don‚Äôt see this option, it means you are not part of the beta testing cohort.

6. Click on ‚ÄúCopy plugin link‚Äù.

7. Head to Figma and open the Maze plugin.

8. Paste the Plugin link you just copied in the box.

9. Select the flows you wish to import.

10. The prototype will be loaded into maze and you will get a confirmation of when the import is complete in the Figma plugin.

11. Once import is complete head back to Maze to set up your paths: from this point on, you can proceed normally in setting up your usability test.

plugins.name: VectorSymbols
plugins.description:
How it works


Library


Selection

Select component or framework nodes with vector layers included in them. Vector layers must have color fill, multi-layer fill and gradient fill are not supported.


Fill rule

It refers to the fill-rule of a path (SVG).

  • Nonzero: Better client compatibility, and shorter string lengths.
  • Evenodd: Better contextual semantics and more flexible post-adjustment.

Export settings


  • Export name: Compression file name, icon ID and CSS global variable prefix.
  • Round: The precision of the path coordinate points should be no less than 3 decimal places.


Export

  • IconsName-symbol.svg: SVG Symbol file. It will convert your color styles to CSS global variables. If you have any unfilled icons, you will need to use the "fill" attribute to fill them.
  • IconsName.json: The original data structure of the icons, which can be used as a basis for customization.
  • src: The SVG files that include CSS global variable styles..
  • Upcoming support for React component exports and Figma Variables.


SVG Symbol Example

<html>
<body>

  <svg id='Icons' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' style='display:none'>
    <style>svg{--icons_dark_accent_s: #20D5EC;}</style>
    <symbol id='icons_icon_person_fill' viewBox='0 0 48 48'>
      <path fill-rule='evenodd' clip-rule='evenodd'
        d='M24 4C18.48 4 14 8.48 14 14C14 19.52 18.48 24 24 24C29.52 24 34 19.52 34 14C34 8.48 29.52 4 24 4zM24 27C13.06 27 7 34.92 7 41.44C7 45 9 45 16 45L32 45C39 45 41 45 41 41.44C41 34.92 34.94 27 24 27z' />
    </symbol>
    <symbol id='icons_icon_person_arrow_left_right' viewBox='0 0 48 48'>
      <path fill-rule='evenodd' clip-rule='evenodd'
        d='M29.001 14C29.001 8.48 24.531 4 19.001 4C13.481 4 9.001 8.48 9.001 14C9.001 19.52 13.481 24 19.001 24C24.531 24 29.001 19.52 29.001 14zM13.001 14C13.001 10.69 15.691 8 19.001 8C22.321 8 25.001 10.69 25.001 14C25.001 17.31 22.321 20 19.001 20C15.691 20 13.001 17.31 13.001 14z'
        fill='var(--icons_dark_accent_s)' />
      <path
        d='M24 27.613C22.459 27.211 20.789 27 19.001 27C8.721 27 2.351 33.99 2.021 44C2.001 44.55 2.451 45 3.001 45L5.001 45C5.561 45 6.001 44.55 6.021 44C6.321 36.16 10.921 31 19.001 31C20.853 31 22.523 31.271 24 31.782C24 30.392 24 29.003 24 27.613z'
        fill='var(--icons_dark_accent_s)' />
      <path
        d='M41.5 30.65L29 30.65C28.448 30.65 28 30.202 28 29.65L28 28.35C28 27.798 28.448 27.35 29 27.35L41.5 27.35L38.644 24.87C38.206 24.49 38.182 23.818 38.592 23.408L39.46 22.54C39.85 22.15 40.483 22.15 40.874 22.54L46.167 27.833C46.811 28.478 46.811 29.522 46.167 30.167L40.874 35.46C40.483 35.85 39.85 35.85 39.46 35.46L38.592 34.592C38.182 34.182 38.206 33.51 38.644 33.13L41.5 30.65z'
        fill='var(--icons_dark_accent_s)' />
      <path
        d='M30.5 39.35L43 39.35C43.552 39.35 44 39.798 44 40.35L44 41.65C44 42.202 43.552 42.65 43 42.65L30.5 42.65L33.356 45.13C33.794 45.51 33.818 46.182 33.408 46.592L32.54 47.46C32.15 47.85 31.517 47.85 31.126 47.46L25.833 42.167C25.189 41.522 25.189 40.478 25.833 39.833L31.126 34.54C31.517 34.15 32.15 34.15 32.54 34.54L33.408 35.408C33.818 35.818 33.794 36.49 33.356 36.87L30.5 39.35z'
        fill='var(--icons_dark_accent_s)' />
    </symbol>
  </svg>

  <svg width="48" height="48" fill="#121212">
    <use xlink:href="#icons_icon_person_arrow_left_right" />
  </svg>

</body>
</html>


Production


Constraints

Support one-click setting of x, y axis (scale, center) constraints.


Stroke width

The tool presets line segments of different thicknesses, and you can also click the "+" in the upper right corner to create other line thicknesses. Closed paths also support setting the direction of the line segments.


Component tag

You can bulk add text fields to icon components, which makes them easier to search for.
plugins.tagline: Fast, easy and practical powerful icon production and batch export tool.

plugins.name: RTL support
plugins.description:
Flip RTL languages like hebrew and arabic.
Can deal with mixed content and will adjust font and textbox size so you can understand wrapping.

Instructions:

1. Select a text layer
2. Run the plugin
3. Edit the text, text will change as you type
**** new *****
4. You can select any other text field on stage and edit it as you wish. 
5. If you resize the field, the text will keep its original wrapping. use the refresh button to sort the wrapping again

Have fun. Hopefully this will get Figma to support this from the properties window....

plugins.name: Placemark
plugins.description:
Use Figma to create purely vector street-level maps with Placemark. This plugin is a bit different than the rest. By loading data from OpenStreetMap, it enables you to create maps without an API key. As long as you credit OpenStreetMap, you can also freely print and republish the maps you make.


This plugin directly loads data and transforms it into vector data, which means:


  • Styles for the map can be defined in Figma, rather than in a separate map design tool
  • You can move, edit, and move map data like you do with any other drawn feature


Plus, some cool features:


  • Customizable label sizes with label collision detection to prevent overlapping labels
  • Ability to add your own GeoJSON data to the map


Note that this is a particular solution to the problem, so it has certain caveats:


  • Maps need to be zoomed in. You can't use this tool to create world-scale maps - it's better for mapping neighborhoods.


This plugin is open source! Follow along or contribute on GitHub.


Also check out Placemark Globe, the companion plugin that generates globes!

accepted.name: Tom MacWright
accepted.description: Tinkering on the side, building Figma plugins, mostly for cartography.

plugins.tagline: Free vector street maps

plugins.name: Codify AI - Figma to Code - Vue, React, Angular, Html, Tailwind, Json, Css
plugins.description:
Through simple configuration, Codify can generate the component library code and CSS styles used in your project. Even if you don't want to do this, Codify can still generate more beautiful Tailwind CSS code for you.


üèµÔ∏è Major upgrade:

  1. [NEW] Codify now supports AI-powered code optimization.


  1. [NEW] We have fully mapped the Ant Design component library to the Codify plugin. By using our optimized new version of the Ant Design UIKit, you can generate code more effortlessly, without needing to spend time on configuration.


  1. [NEW] The Layer Tags panel has been added, allowing you to intuitively add custom styles and styles to be ignored by the plugin through the UI interface. After setting theLayer tags, you can click "Generate" to view the changes in the generated code.


üöÄ Features:


  1. Mapping Component libraries. Instead of generating.
  2. Mapping Class name. You can define class names like: "tw-".
  3. Generate cleaner component code. You can open the Playground file to inspect the component examples I provide.
  4. One-click export of CSS utilities. We don't presumptuously generate redundant CSS styles for every codegen. So, if your project doesn't use Tailwind or similar CSS utility libraries, we recommend you create your own CSS utility classes. That's why we've provided a one-click export.
  5. Shared with team members. Ensuring consistent code generation.


üîó Related:


  1. Codify Development Documentation
  2. Codify Dashboard
  3. Free UIKit Component Templates
  4. Free Ant Design UIKit


üôà Privacy Notice:


Codify is a fast code generation plugin that can instantly convert the nodes you have selected into development-ready code. The reason it can do this is that we have placed both the Figma layer parsing and the renderer on the plugin side, so it all runs on your local device. Access to the network is only for the purpose of obtaining the user's subscription permissions and configuration files.It does not read or store any of your Figma information.


üí¨ For any issues encountered during use, please comment here, or join our community on Discord. I would love to help you.
plugins.tagline: [AI-powered] Map your front-end components and generate development-ready code

plugins.name: Font Collections: Google Fonts, Variable Fonts, & Pairing
plugins.description:
Font Management and Typography Plugin


Elevate your design process with our comprehensive font management plugin, tailored for Figma users. Discover how typography can transform your projects with our intuitive and user-friendly features.


Features:

Font Preview:

Experience your text in various styles. Simply enter a phrase and instantly preview how it looks in different fonts, making the perfect choice effortless.


Variable Fonts:

Unleash the power of typography with variable fonts. Easily filter and preview different font axes to find the exact style and weight you need for your design.


Font Pairing:

plugins.name: Select by Font
plugins.description:
Figma‚Äôs Selection Color tool but for Fonts and Styles.


Easily view all the distinct fonts used in the current selection. Then, select all text nodes of a similar font.


WHY THIS PLUGIN WILL CHANGE YOUR WORKFLOW

This plugin removes the pain of finding and selecting text nodes.


Designers relate a text node with its purpose - heading, caption, label, warning etc. A well crafted design system has font style names that match the purpose of the style. Thus, font types and style names are the best way to get to a text node. This plugin makes that possible.


In our beta testing, designers who use this plugin use it so often and after a while can‚Äôt imagine their workflow without it. The plugin is designed to be a narrow and vertical dialog so that it can be kept open while you are working on your designs.


LATEST RELEASE

Longer style names are now fully visible



HOW TO USE THE PLUGIN


STEP 1

Select a frame or a group of frames


STEP 2

Run the plugin to see the distinct list of fonts used in the selection


STEP 3

Click on the Font or Style Name to select ALL the text nodes that match that style.


STEP 4

If you make any changes to font or style, then refresh to update the font list.


COMING SOON

Cycle through text node selection

Auto refresh font list after changes are made

Spell check on text nodes

plugins.name: Distort edges
plugins.description:
A personal experiment replicating Adobe Illustrator‚Äôs Distort Edges Filter on Figma. Select a shape or vector layer to apply Distort Edges to.


Variable Distortion Distance

When enabled, distortion offset will be randomised, producing a ‚Äúroughened‚Äù effect.


Maximum Distortion Offset Distance

Specifies how much distance the distortion will go. When Variable Distortion Distance has been enabled, the distortion will not go further than this distance.


Variable Distances Between Points

When enabled, each distorted point (apex) will be applied a randomised distance apart from each other, producing an even more natural ‚Äúroughened‚Äù effect.


Distance Between Points (Minimum, Maximum, Single)

If variable distances between points has been enabled, specifies the minimum and maximum limits the randomised distance should fall between. Otherwise, specifies the uniform distance apart each apex should be from each other.


Peak / Trough Roundness

Specify how round or sharp the apexes going outwards and inwards should be.


Keep Layer Dimensions

When enabled, forces the distortion to keep within the original dimensions of the shape.


Force Distortion On Small Distances

An additional setting to force distortion on path segments that measure less than the specified Distance Between Points. By default the script skips these segments as the distortions can result in ‚Äúunnaturally spiky‚Äù micro-segments.



Applying Distort Edges to multiple smaller complex paths is faster than applying it to a single large complex path merged from the multiple paths.



Online sampler here.

Examples Timer / Solar / Linework / Rotation



JS script for the distortion here.

Source code here.
plugins.tagline: Distort and roughen shape edges

plugins.name: Figma to React Native
plugins.description:
All in One Figma to React Native plugin. Design Tokens + Code Generation + Sync with GitHub in one single plugin!


‚úÖ Features

  • Import Figma Styles into Design Tokens like Color Styles, Text Styles, Effect Styles and Grid Styles.
  • Batch edit Figma Properties using Design Tokens. Choose a token and update all Figma linked properties at once.
  • Generate React Native code for any selected Figma Node. If you are using Auto Layout, generate responsive / usable React Native code for any Figma Node you select (i.e. an entire screen/frame or just a container). Choose between StyleSheet, Restyle (including Restyle Theme) and styled-components libraries for the generated code.


‚úÖ How does it work?

  • First, create as many Figma Styles as you want and use them on your Figma Document. Once you open the plugin, it will automatically convert them into Design Tokens and you will be able to export them to JSON or directly send to a GitHub repository.
  • On the plugin UI, create as many custom Design Tokens as you want. Create tokens for sizes, spacing, borders etc, link them to Token Groups (you can also create groups like Sizes, Spacing, etc) and they will be also exported to code whenever you want.
  • On the plugin UI, link your tokens to Figma properties. When the plugin is opened and you select a Figma Node (like a Frame representing a screen), you can see all node properties on the Properties Tab. Link any of those properties to any of your Design Tokens (i.e. paddingBottom to a XL Spacing token, for example). Later you will be able to change your token value and update all linked properties at once.
  • Where is the plugin data stored? All the plugin data is stored as part of the Figma document / file. The data you see when you open the plugin depends on which document is opened at the moment (current page doesn't matter).
  • Who can see my Design Tokens? If you have a team of designers and developers, anyone that access the same document and open the plugin inside it will be able to see and update the tokens (including properties linked tokens).


üöß Roadmap

  • Support StyleSheet code generation
  • Support Restyle code generation (currently only theme code is generated properly)
  • Smart Tokens (ability to use percentage and math expressions to token values)
  • Auto update Figma when tokens are changed

plugins.name: Drag & Drop
plugins.description:
Simply drag the useful stickers and drop where you want them to appear!



  1. Select the SVG you want on the plugin,
  2. Start dragging it into the target are,
  3. Simply drop where it want you to appeare!



Story:

I'm a student designer based in Berlin and I always use these mini stickers in my workflow to indicate something rather to me or my colleagues. I also had the idea of developing a plugin since I learned a bit of Vue and JS during the pandemic then looking at current tools I realized that there is not a tool that you can just drag and drop something to the area you want.


Then I've discovered that Figma has a very open and collaborative developer space, using all of these free resources and building on top of them, I've built my first plugin. I'm so happy to share it with you ‚ù§Ô∏è!


Resources & Inspirations:


BIG THANKS! to jackiecorn and thomas-lowry wi

hout their starter GitHub repos I couldn't be able to put such features together.


Drag & Drop Starter Template:

‚Ä®https://github.com/jackiecorn/figma-plugin-drag-and-drop


Figma Plugin Webpack Sample:

https://github.com/figma/plugin-samples/tree/master/webpack


Icons:

https://feathericons.com/



Send Your SVGs and Feedback!


Send me your SVGs so I can include them on the next relase, you can also share any feedback. I also plan to share the codebase soon on Github (Might need some real developer help first though, some stuff might be too messy to share :D).

plugins.name: Lights
plugins.description:
Easily switch between light and dark mode using Lights


How it works:

1) Create your light and dark color palettes by creating and naming your color styles using "Light / [name]" and "Dark / [name]"

2) Apply your color styles accordingly to your layers on the canvas

3) Select the layers that you'd like to convert, then choose Lights > On for light mode or Lights > Off for dark mode


Note: Styles from external libraries are currently unsupported. Only styles created inside of your file are supported at the moment

plugins.name: Figma To Elementor
plugins.description:
Figma plugin to easily convert Figma design into Elementor widgets. The json data generated from this plugin can be directly pasted into Elementor editor with right click on elementor editor > paste from other site > Ctrl +V. Working with auto layout or non auto layout design. For non auto layout design it works better for well-grouped design.


This plugin will automatically recognize any locked node or node with name containing "image" word as an image. For example if you have a group or frame with name "image-group" and don't want to be converted as an image, you need to change it's name.


Switch on the option "Convert without connection", if You are having problems connecting your website. This option will upload all the images to our temporary server. All the images will be uploaded on your website when the json data is pasted on Elementor editor.


The application password authentication only working on website with https. To try it on local environment, add this line of code on wp-config.php file:


define( 'WP_ENVIRONMENT_TYPE', 'local' );


Tips:

  1. Use "button" name to convert as button block
  2. Group the image parts in 1 group and lock it to be converted as an image widget or image background for a container
  3. When you encounter a broken layout in the preview, try grouping the broken parts manually before converting it again.


Make sure to enable svg support on Elementor and install svg support plugin to enable upload svg on Your WordPress website.


Check this video tutorial

Buy license key here

plugins.name: Figma to AI Code by DesignCode
plugins.description:
Turn your Figma designs into production-level code with the power of Claude AI and GPT-4o. This plugin supports multiple frameworks such as React, SwiftUI, Tailwind, Flutter and delivers accurate, prompt-able code for web-based and mobile outputs, making design-to-code conversion a powerful workflow in Figma.


Here's a course for making apps using Claude AI: https://designcode.io/cursor


Why Figma to AI Code?


ü§ñ AI-Powered Precision


Built with OpenAI GPT-4o and Anthropic Claude, you can integrate your own API keys for maximum flexibility and control.


üéØ Wide Framework Support


Convert designs into:

‚Ä¢HTML + CSS or Tailwind CSS

‚Ä¢React, Vue, Svelte with CSS or Tailwind CSS

‚Ä¢SwiftUI, React Native, Flutter, or Jetpack Compose


üí° Smart Features


‚Ä¢Real-time previews for HTML outputs

‚Ä¢Syntax highlighting for easier editing

‚Ä¢Custom prompts for tailored results

‚Ä¢One-click code copying

‚Ä¢Responsive design conversion

‚Ä¢Preserves hierarchy, styles, and layouts


üí´ Developer-Friendly Code


‚Ä¢Clean, maintainable output

‚Ä¢Adheres to framework best practices

‚Ä¢Optimized for responsive designs

‚Ä¢Component-based architecture for reusability


Designed for developers and designers alike, this plugin streamlines your workflow and minimizes time spent on manual coding. Focus on creativity, and let AI handle the heavy lifting.

plugins.name: Skew To Figma
plugins.description:
Selecting an Element üñºÔ∏è

  • In your project, click to select the element you want to skew (it can be a shape, text, etc.).


Adjusting the Tilt üîß

  • With the plugin open, you will see two sliders:
  • One for Horizontal Tilt ‚ÜîÔ∏è.
  • Another for Vertical Tilt ‚ÜïÔ∏è.
  • Drag the sliders to adjust the tilt as desired.
  • Watch real-time changes to your selected element.


Resetting the Tilt üîÑ

  • If you want to return to the original state, click the "Reset" button.
  • This will remove all skews applied to the selected element.


Finalizing and Applying Changes ‚úÖ

  • Once you are satisfied with the slope, you can continue editing your project.
  • Changes made with the plugin will be saved in your design.
plugins.tagline: Add free dynamism to your design with accurate, easy-to-use tilts!

plugins.name: Aspect Ratio
plugins.description:
üîå Aspect Ratio is a Figma-optimized aspect ratio calculator and layer resizing tool.


‚öôÔ∏è Features

‚Ä¢Inspect: When you select any layer, its aspect ratio is displayed in the inspector.

‚Ä¢Calculate: Input a value in the center field to instantly calculate the corresponding dimension.

‚Ä¢Resize: Apply the calculated value to the selected layer(s) with a single click.

‚Ä¢Batch Resize: Resize multiple layers at once.

‚Ä¢Arrow Key Support: Adjust values using your keyboard arrow keys.

‚Ä¢Theme Switcher: Choose between light and dark modes to suit your workflow.

plugins.name: Unipaste
plugins.description:
Unipaste delivers the easiest way to work with special characters in Figma.


Key features

  • 500+ glyphs
  • Search
  • Favorites
  • List/Grid layout
  • Direct text editing
  • Fully keyboard controllable
  • Available in Figma and FigJam
  • Dark mode support


How to use

  • If you are editing text, the glyphs is inserted at the cursor position or instead of the selected part of the text.
  • Otherwise, the glyph is copied to the clipboard.
  • With the text node selected: The left mouse button inserts a character at the beginning of the text, the right mouse button at the end of the text.


Keyboard controls

  • Arrow down: Enter the list/grid
  • Arrows: Navigate in the list/grid
  • Enter: Paste the selected glyph into design (and close Unipaste plugin)
  • Esc: Close Unipaste plugin


Roadmap

  • Parameter input support ‚úÖ
  • FigJam support ‚úÖ
  • Keyboard control ‚úÖ
  • Searching by HTML entity name ‚úÖ
  • Dark mode ‚úÖ
  • Anything that comes out of the feedback


Warning

Fonts typically do not contain all unicode characters, so for some exotic characters, the character may not be visible in the text.
plugins.tagline: Tool for inserting symbols/characters/glyphs into your design.

plugins.name: Stippling
plugins.description:
Creating stippling in Figma has never been easier than this stippling plugin.

Just select any image or frame and play with the setting to generate cool effects.


Features

FREE

  1. Adjust shape size
  2. Shape type - Dot, Rectangle, Line, Hex, Triangle, Text(Pro)
  3. Spacing adjustment
  4. Contrast control
  5. All vector/svg


FREE + PRO

  1. Every feature is free to use. Only charging a one-time fee to continue developing new features. Currently, the Text Feature is available only for Pro users.


Grab License from lemonsqueezy

Early User Discount Code 50%: FIGMA50


Grab playground file to check how to create cool posters - Playground file

Live website - stippling.app


Note:

  1. If your image or frame is larger than 1000px, adjust the slider slowly.
  2. The process generates vector nodes, so the larger the image, the longer it takes.
  3. It‚Äôs better to scale down the image before using the plugin for better performance.

plugins.name: Checklist Creator
plugins.description:
Easily create elegant checklists to keep track of your design progress.


What it does

The plugin creates a frame with your tasks and checkpoints organised in a table. It also creates status labels (Todo, in progress, awaiting feedback, done, n-a) as variants of a status component.


How to create a checklist

Tasks

Insert the tasks or pages you need to design separated by commas (Ex: Homepage, About, Contact). You may also use "/" to add a separator line between different groups of tasks. (Ex: Navigation, Footer, / , Homepage, About).


Checkpoints

Insert the deliverables needed for your tasks separated by commas (Ex: Wireframes, Mobile design, Desktop design).


How to use it

While designing, easily update the status labels in Figma ui. Select a label in the table and modify its status in the component properties (right panel).


Reorganise the checklist and labels

Tasks list is a vertical auto layout frame. That makes it very easy to reorder, remove or add new tasks.


Separation lines can also be duplicated and moved vertically to organise tasks in groups.


(Hint : use top and bottom keys to reorder tasks rows and separation lines).


The labels are variants of a component. That makes it possible to add new ones or modify those automatically generated by the plug in.


Developed by

Karim Maaloul creative director at EPIC Agency

accepted.name: Karim Maaloul
accepted.description: Co-founder and Creative Director at EPIC Agency
